title: Venom
data:
| . [![Acid venom.png](/images/1/1b/Acid_venom.png)](/wiki/File:Acid_venom.png) |                                 |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------- |
| Name                                                                          | acid venom                      |
| Appearance                                                                    | acid venom                      |
| Base price                                                                    | 0 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid") |
| Weight                                                                        | [1](/wiki/Weight "Weight")      |

| . [![Blinding venom.png](/images/3/3c/Blinding_venom.png)](/wiki/File:Blinding_venom.png) |                                 |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------- |
| Name                                                                                      | blinding venom                  |
| Appearance                                                                                | blinding venom                  |
| Base price                                                                                | 0 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid") |
| Weight                                                                                    | [1](/wiki/Weight "Weight")      |

Some monsters spit **venom** at you, which acts as a projectile attack. This takes the form of either:

- **blinding venom**, which [blinds](/wiki/Blind "Blind") you as a [cream pie](/wiki/Cream_pie "Cream pie") when you are hit by it, or
- **acid venom**, which deals 2d6 [acid](/wiki/Acid "Acid") damage.

[Juiblex](/wiki/Juiblex "Juiblex") and [black nagas](/wiki/Black_naga "Black naga") spit acid venom; [guardian nagas](/wiki/Guardian_naga "Guardian naga") and [cobras](/wiki/Cobra "Cobra") spit blinding venom.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Effects](#Effects)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 History](#History)
- [5 References](#References)

## Generation

Internally, objects for venom exist (to act as the projectiles), but they almost always disappear upon hitting anything. However, you can create them by [polymorphing](/wiki/Polymorphing "Polymorphing") into the respective mosters and spitting venom into [water](/wiki/Moat "Moat") with the [#monster](/wiki/Monster_\(command\) "Monster (command)") command, e.g., on [Medusa's Island](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Island "Medusa's Island") or any pool if you manage to hit it exactly. The permanent venom objects can then be picked up the usual way by diving or by [levitating](/wiki/Levitating "Levitating") with a [bullwhip](/wiki/Bullwhip "Bullwhip"). And of course, a [wizard mode](/wiki/Wizard_mode "Wizard mode") wish can create them.

## Effects

They are listed under the inventory heading "Venoms", and both appear as "a splash of venom" when unidentified. When thrown, they will have the expected effects. A stack of them can also be quivered. Attempting to [engrave](/wiki/Engrave "Engrave") with this item prompts a [YAFM](/wiki/YAFM "YAFM"): "Writing a poison pen letter?"

They can be [greased](/wiki/Greased "Greased") (even though science is unsure how that works), but that is not necessary as they are surprisingly robust and waterproof. Getting venom objects out of a [container](/wiki/Container "Container") is tricky, because the menu code doesn't expect them to exist. You must either switch the *menustyle* [option](/wiki/Option "Option") to *traditional* or use the #[tip](/wiki/Tip "Tip") command.

## Strategy

A fun use is to blind the [Riders](/wiki/Riders "Riders") with them: it's easier than polymorphing into a guardian naga on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"), and they weigh less than a stack of cream pies.

## History

[NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") would crash when listing the contents of a container with venom objects in it while generating the [dumplog](/wiki/Dumplog "Dumplog") at the end of a game. In particular this meant you had to take all venom out of your [bag of holding](/wiki/Bag_of_holding "Bag of holding") into your main inventory before [ascending](/wiki/Ascend "Ascend"); otherwise, NetHack would segfault immediately before the ascension was counted as complete in the server stats.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) This bug has been fixed since 3.6.0.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [incomplete dumplog](https://s3.amazonaws.com/altorg/dumplog/Luna1/1395185008.nh343.txt) due to NAO server segfaulting

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.1. Click here for more information.](/images/d/d3/Nh361-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.1. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-361}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Venom

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
.
Name acid venom
Appearance acid venom
Base price 0 zm
Weight 1
.
Name blinding venom
Appearance blinding venom
Base price 0 zm
Weight 1

Some monsters spit venom at you, which acts as a projectile attack. This takes the form of either:

  • blinding venom, which blinds you as a cream pie when you are hit by it, or
  • acid venom, which deals 2d6 acid damage.

Juiblex and black nagas spit acid venom; guardian nagas and cobras spit blinding venom.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Effects
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 History
  • 5 References

Generation

Internally, objects for venom exist (to act as the projectiles), but they almost always disappear upon hitting anything. However, you can create them by polymorphing into the respective mosters and spitting venom into water with the #monster command, e.g., on Medusa's Island or any pool if you manage to hit it exactly. The permanent venom objects can then be picked up the usual way by diving or by levitating with a bullwhip. And of course, a wizard mode wish can create them.

Effects

They are listed under the inventory heading "Venoms", and both appear as "a splash of venom" when unidentified. When thrown, they will have the expected effects. A stack of them can also be quivered. Attempting to engrave with this item prompts a YAFM: "Writing a poison pen letter?"

They can be greased (even though science is unsure how that works), but that is not necessary as they are surprisingly robust and waterproof. Getting venom objects out of a container is tricky, because the menu code doesn't expect them to exist. You must either switch the menustyle option to traditional or use the #tip command.

Strategy

A fun use is to blind the Riders with them: it's easier than polymorphing into a guardian naga on the Astral Plane, and they weigh less than a stack of cream pies.

History

NetHack 3.4.3 would crash when listing the contents of a container with venom objects in it while generating the dumplog at the end of a game. In particular this meant you had to take all venom out of your bag of holding into your main inventory before ascending; otherwise, NetHack would segfault immediately before the ascension was counted as complete in the server stats.[1] This bug has been fixed since 3.6.0.

References

  1. ↑ incomplete dumplog due to NAO server segfaulting

This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.6.1. Information on this page may be out of date.

Some monsters spit '''venom''' at you, which acts as a projectile attack. This takes the form of either: 
* '''blinding venom''', which [[blind]]s you as a [[cream pie]] when you are hit by it, or
* '''acid venom''', which deals 2d6 [[acid]] damage.

[[Juiblex]] and [[black naga]]s spit acid venom; [[guardian naga]]s and [[cobra]]s spit blinding venom.

== Generation ==
Internally, objects for venom exist (to act as the projectiles), but they almost always disappear upon hitting anything. However, you can create them by [[polymorphing]] into the respective mosters and spitting venom into [[moat|water]] with the [[Monster (command)|#monster]] command, e.g., on [[Medusa's Island]] or any pool if you manage to hit it exactly. The permanent venom objects can then be picked up the usual way by diving or by [[levitating]] with a [[bullwhip]]. And of course, a [[wizard mode]] wish can create them.

== Effects ==
They are listed under the inventory heading "Venoms", and both appear as "a splash of venom" when unidentified. When thrown, they will have the expected effects. A stack of them can also be quivered. Attempting to [[engrave]] with this item prompts a [[YAFM]]: "Writing a poison pen letter?"

They can be [[greased]] (even though science is unsure how that works), but that is not necessary as they are surprisingly robust and waterproof. Getting venom objects out of a [[container]] is tricky, because the menu code doesn't expect them to exist. You must either switch the ''menustyle'' [[option]] to ''traditional'' or use the #[[tip]] command.

== Strategy ==
A fun use is to blind the [[Riders]] with them: it's easier than polymorphing into a guardian naga on the [[Astral Plane]], and they weigh less than a stack of cream pies. 

== History ==
[[NetHack 3.4.3]] would crash when listing the contents of a container with venom objects in it while generating the [[dumplog]] at the end of a game. In particular this meant you had to take all venom out of your [[bag of holding]] into your main inventory before [[ascend]]ing; otherwise, NetHack would segfault immediately before the ascension was counted as complete in the server stats.<ref>[https://s3.amazonaws.com/altorg/dumplog/Luna1/1395185008.nh343.txt incomplete dumplog] due to NAO server segfaulting</ref> This bug has been fixed since 3.6.0.
